document.docTitle: Stelletta makushina Lehnert & Stone, 2014, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Aleutian Ancorinidae (Porifera, Astrophorida): Description of three new species from the genera Stelletta and Ancorina

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Aleutian Ancorinidae (Porifera, Astrophorida): Description of three new species from the genera Stelletta and Ancorina

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Holotype , ZSM 20140111 , specimen in ethanol, collected by Robert Stone with a camera array towed from the FV Sea Storm ;
8 August 2012
, 177 m depth, 4 km NNE of Bishop Point, Unalaska Island, eastern Aleutian Islands, Bering Sea (
54 °00.499” N
,
166 ° 56.136 ” W
). Attached to a large cobble. Bottom water temperature = 4.2 °C.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2A–F.
Stelletta makushina
n. sp.
A, Holotype at left.
Stelletta ovalae Tanita, 1965
at right. Grid marks are 1 cm. B, left: through the cortex (dark band) protruding triaenes, right: interior of sponge. Scale bar is 500 µm. C, Cladomes of protruding triaenes. Scale bar is 500 µm. D, Cladome of anatriaene. Scale bar is 100 µm. E, Plagiotriaene. Scale bar is 200 µm. F, Plagiotriaene with two reduced club-shaped rays. Scale bar is 200.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Discussion.
Stelletta makushina
n. sp. differs from all other known species of
Stelletta
(
Table 1
) and has peculiar ortho- to plagiotriaenes which have a high percentage of reduced, club-shaped clads and very long rhabdomes (up to 7.32 mm ). Similar reduced cladomes occur in
Stelletta atrophia
Hoshino 1981
(
Table 1
) but, its rhabdomes are much shorter (maximum 2 mm ) and
S . atrophia
lacks anatriaenes, has shorter oxeas and has an additional microsclere category of strongylasters (
Table 1
).
S . calyx
Sim & Kim 2003
(
Table 1
) also has shorter rhabdomes of the orthotriaenes, lacks anatriaenes, has shorter oxeas and two additional categories of strongylasters.
S . clarella
de
Laubenfels 1930
(
Table 1
) has much shorter megascleres, except for the dichotriaenes which are longer, and a second category of oxeas.
S . orthotriaena
Koltun, 1966
(
Table 1
) from the Kuril Islands has long but, still considerably shorter, ortho- and plagiotriaenes, shorter oxeas, and tylasters instead of oxyasters.
Etymology. Named after the massive Makushin Volcano that prominently guards the northern end of Unalaska Island where the holotype was collected.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2G–L.
Stelletta makushina
n. sp.
G, Triaene with three club-shaped rays. Scale bar is 100 µm. H, Diaene, two clubshaped rays. Scale bar is 100 µm. I, Monaene, one club-shaped ray. Scale bar is 200 µm. J, Protriaene. Scale bar is 200 µm. K, Cladome of dichotriaene. Scale bar is 200 µm. L, Oxyaster. Scale bar is 2 µm.

TABLE 1. Distribution, spicule categories and measurements of species of the genus
Stelletta
species from the North Pacific Ocean, Bering Sea, and the North Atlantic Ocean. measurements are in µm, unless otherwise noted.
